ch.ethz.inf.vs.appserver
Class AppServer

java.lang.Object
  endpoint.Endpoint
      endpoint.LocalEndpoint
          ch.ethz.inf.vs.appserver.AppServer
All Implemented Interfaces:
coap.MessageHandler, coap.MessageReceiver
public class AppServer
extends endpoint.LocalEndpoint

An app server creates a structure of CoAP resources to run arbitrary JavaScript apps on it. Most Notably an InstallResource to install new apps and an AppResource which holds the instances of those apps.

An app or its subresources must not block the receiver thread of Californium. Therefore every app has its own thread for handling requests. If a requests has an app or a subresource of an app as target the server passes the request to this app, which's receiver thread then will handle the request.

Author:
Martin Lanter
